column4: what would cause an ubuntu machine to open thousands of active sessions to my isp's dns ??
visiting a porn website
but the machine is just sittingthere -- headless
nobosy is even loged into it
and its purpose is?
so it's a router?
so is the headless box the ubuntu box or the router?
the router is just where i see all the connections
okay, and what purpose does it serve? firewall? what?
the ubunto box?
there's another 'it' that i'm referring to?
it's a slave 3D renderer for Blender 3D
okay. is it running any network services of any kind?
if it is i'm not certain because i didn't set it up for any other purpose than to act as an available 3D renderer for distributed rendering -- all machines are local
in my router i see this...  http://pastebin.com/m1178172d  except for twenty plus pages of it...
i originally set it up using a monitor, but i only ssh to it now so i can start renders
looks like someone on 192.168.69.44 is browsing the web
in a tcp dump i see no http - only the dns stuff
well you'll need to look on .44 and figure out what app is trying to hit that ip
#networking might be able to help you out a bit better
thanks for theawesome tip!
